properties.areaDesc: Mono; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Northern Washoe County; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California; Greater Lake Tahoe Area
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 21 at 2:21PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
A weak storm system will bring gusty winds across the eastern
Sierra into western Nevada this afternoon and evening. Wind gusts
of 35 to 45 mph are expected across eastern California and far
western Nevada. A short period of stronger wind gusts over 50 mph
are likely along the I-580/US-395 corridor from eastern Lassen
County southward across Reno, Washoe Valley, and into far northern
Mono County. For the Sierra ridges, gusts up to 90 mph are
expected.

These winds may produce travel restrictions for high profile
vehicles, along with rough lake conditions and areas of turbulence
for aviation.

In addition, light snowfall could produce travel impacts for the
main Sierra passes west of Lake Tahoe this afternoon and evening.
Snowfall totals up to 3 inches are expected for Donner Summit,
Echo Summit, and Carson Pass. Lighter snowfall, generally an inch
or less, could reach parts of the Lake Tahoe basin, Mt. Rose
Summit, the Surprise Valley, and near the Sierra crest in Mono
county.

Across western Nevada, most areas will be shadowed out of rain and
snow, except for a period of light rain and snow in far northern
Washoe County through tonight.

NWSheadline: Gusty Winds from the Sierra to Western Nevada through This evening, with a Few Inches of Snowfall on Sierra Passes
